Beaker
Blog Documentation Install Beaker

What makes Beaker different?

Easy Hosting

Share files and websites from your device.

Versioning

Access the history of your content with built-in semantic versioning.
(Coming Soon)

Confidentiality

Control who sees your content with secret sharing links.

Beaker uses Peer-to-Peer protocols to host sites directly from your browser. No signup is required. The protocol's advanced features enable secure, versioned publishing with confidential sharing.

See: What can I build with Beaker?

Try the Beta

We're still building! Our source-code is modified MIT-licensed, and our issue tracker is open too. Join us in #beakerbrowser on Freenode.

Read the Docs Download the Beta

FAQ

What do peer-to-peer URLs look like?
They're 64-character hex strings.
Read more »
Can I use DNS to create short URLs?
Yes, but it's not secure yet.
Read more »
Is the network anonymous?
No. Other users are able to see your IP.
Read more »
Why p2p instead of servers?
Creative freedom and data-security!
Read more »
Can I browse regular HTTP/S sites?
Yes, Beaker browses the normal Web.
Read more »
Is Beaker built entirely from scratch?
No, it's a fork of the Chrome browser.
Read more »
